transcript.title: VISIT BY THE PRESIDENT OF HUNGARY
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce that the President of Hungary, His Excellency

Arpad Goncz, will visit Australia from 15 February to 21 February.

The President will travel to Sydney, Canberra and Melbourne.

This is the first visit to Australia by a Hungarian head of state

and the visit provides an excellent opportunity to expand the relationship

between our two countries.

Hungary was a significant source of post-war migration to Australia

and today our Hungarian community numbers around 70,000 people. In

addition to drawing attention to the Hungarian contribution to Australia,

this visit will give a timely boost to our commercial links.

As a country with a growing economy and prospects for membership of

the European Union, Hungary is a valuable partner for Australia in

eastern Europe. Similarly Australia's place in the Asia-Pacific

region offers opportunities to Hungary.

I look forward to welcoming the President to Australia.
